serviceEstimatedCost.title: Estimated Cost
serviceEstimatedCost.descriptionFreeInstance: Below is the estimated cost based on your current service configuration
serviceEstimatedCost.descriptionFixedScaling: Below is the estimated cost based on your current service configuration. Resources are billed by the second.
serviceEstimatedCost.descriptionScaling: Below are the minimum and maximum estimated costs based on your current service configuration. Resources are billed by the second.
serviceEstimatedCost.regionDescriptionFixedScaling: You will have {instanceCount} {instanceName} {instanceCount, plural, =1 {instance} other {instances}} running per region
serviceEstimatedCost.regionDescriptionScaling: You will have between {minInstanceCount} and {maxInstanceCount} {instanceName} {maxInstanceCount, plural, =1 {instance} other {instances}} running per region

accountLocked.title: We cannot offer you access to Koyeb
accountLocked.line1: Your account matches patterns often associated with violations of our <terms>Terms of Service</terms>
accountLocked.line2: While we cannot provide details about the reason(s) triggering this behavior, we have determined that providing access to Koyeb is not possible
accountLocked.line3: If you believe this is a bug, you can <link>verify your identity</link>

deleteAccount.label: Delete account
deleteAccount.description: Once this operation is performed, your account will be permanently deleted
deleteAccount.mustLeaveOrganizations: You must leave or delete all your organizations before you can delete your account

confirmation.title: Delete account
confirmation.description: Your user account will be deleted. Are you sure?

deactivateOrganization.title: Deactivate the organization
deactivateOrganization.description: When you deactivate an organization, all associated resources will be deleted: Apps, Services, Secrets, Domains, GitHub app and API credentials. You can reactivate an organization at any time.
deactivateOrganization.success: We've sent you an email to confirm the deactivation of your organization

reactivateOrganization.title: Reactivate the organization
reactivateOrganization.description: Activate the organization to start using this Koyeb organization again.

deleteOrganization.title: Delete the organization
deleteOrganization.description: Permanently delete the organization and the associated payment information
deleteOrganization.hasUnpaidInvoices: Your organization has unpaid invoices. Settle the outstanding payment to be able to delete the organization.
deleteOrganization.mustBeDeactivated: The organization must first be deactivated before it can be deleted

settings:logout.label: Log out
settings:logout.description: Sign out from the Koyeb control panel

upgradeDialog.description: The current selected instance is available on the {plan} plan at $0/mo. Add a payment method to upgrade and deploy.

buildFailed.title: An error occurred while building your application

cause.before: Different reasons can result in a build failure. The most common ones are:
cause.reason1: The language or package manager used by your application is not supported
cause.reason2: Your application is missing required dependencies
cause.reason3: An invalid configuration results in an error during the build process

solution.line1: First, make sure that your application builds properly on your machine. Build logs also provide useful information to help you identify and resolve the root cause. Read our troubleshooting <link>documentation</link> to view and resolve common errors.
solution.line2: Check the build logs for more details.

runtimeFailed.title: An error occurred while deploying your application

cause.before: Different reasons can result in a deployment failure. The most common ones are:
cause.reason1: The command to launch your application is not defined
cause.reason2: Your application failed to pass the the initial health checks
cause.reason3: The selected Instance type doesn't have enough resource to properly run your application

solution.line1: First, make sure that your application runs properly on your machine. Deployment logs also provide useful information to help you identify and resolve the root cause. Read our troubleshooting <link>documentation</link> to view and resolve common errors.
solution.line2: Check the deployment logs for more details.

tcpProxyUrl.label: TCP proxy
tcpProxyUrl.pending: Initializing TCP proxy. This may take a few seconds...
tcpProxyUrl.unavailable: TCP proxy is unavailable on inactive deployments
tcpProxyUrl.deploymentSleeping: TCP proxy is unavailable because this deployment is currently sleeping (scaled to zero)

build.buildSkipped: This deployment uses a previous build originally created during deployment <link>{deploymentId}</link>

noLogs.expired: No logs available in the {retention, plural, =1 {{retention} day} other {{retention} days}} retention period

waitingForLogs.title: Booting up the magic

noLogs.upgrade: <upgrade>Upgrade</upgrade> your plan to increase retention period

configuration.title: Customize Buildpack settings
configuration.description: Override the default deployment configuration to meet your application's needs

buildCommand.label: Build command
buildCommand.tooltip: The command to build your application during the build phase. If your application does not require a build command, leave this field empty.

runCommand.label: Run command
runCommand.tooltip: The command to run your application once the build is completed

workDirectory.label: Work directory
workDirectory.tooltip: The directory where your source code is located. If not set, the work directory defaults to the root of the repository.

privileged.label: Privileged
privileged.tooltip: When enabled, the service container will run in privileged mode. This advanced feature is useful to get advanced system privileges, for example to start a docker daemon.

dockerfile.title: Dockerfile
dockerfile.description: Build a runnable container image for your project. Requires your repository to contain a Dockerfile.

configuration.title: Customize Dockerfile settings
configuration.description: Override the default deployment configuration to meet your application's needs

dockerfileLocation.label: Dockerfile location
dockerfileLocation.tooltip: The location of your Dockerfile relative to the work directory. If not set, the work directory defaults to the root of the repository.

entrypoint.label: Entrypoint
entrypoint.tooltip: Override the default entrypoint to execute on the container

command.label: Command
command.tooltip: Override the command to execute on the container. To pass build-time variables similar to the ARG instruction, use environment variables.

target.label: Target
target.tooltip: Target build stage: If your Dockerfile contains multi-stage builds, you can choose the target stage to build and deploy by entering its name

workDirectory.label: Work directory
workDirectory.tooltip: The directory where your source code is located. If not set, the work directory defaults to the root of the repository.

privileged.label: Privileged
privileged.tooltip: When enabled, the service container will run in privileged mode. This advanced feature is useful to get advanced system privileges, for example to start a docker daemon.

scaling.title: Scaling
scaling.freeInstanceInfo: The free instance scales down to zero after periods of inactivity. Select any paid instance type to configure scaling.

idlePeriod.label: Idle period
idlePeriod.description: Number of seconds to wait before sleeping the instance if it receives no traffic

lightSleep.label: Enable light sleep
lightSleep.description: Light Sleep reduces cold starts to ~200ms. After scaling to zero, the service stays in Light Sleep for {value}s before going into Deep Sleep.
lightSleep.disabledGpu: Light sleep is only supported on Standard CPU instances

ecoInstance.text: Scale to zero requires a Standard or GPU instance type

hasVolumes.text: Scale to zero can't be enabled when volumes are attached to the service

starterPlan.text: Idle period and light to deep sleep transition customization is available starting the Pro plan

autoscaling.title: Autoscaling targets
autoscaling.description: Configure one or more autoscaling target to automatically adjust the number of required instances
autoscaling.noTargetSelected: One scaling criteria must be set
autoscaling.disabled: Autoscaling can only be configured if the maximum number of instances is greater than one and the minimum and maximum instance counts are not equal
autoscaling.hasVolumes: Autoscaling can't be configured when volumes are attached to the service

requests.label: Request per second
requests.description: Autoscale to target {value} requests per second on average, per instance

concurrentRequests.label: Concurrent requests
concurrentRequests.description: Autoscale to target {value} concurrent connections, per instance

responseTime.label: P95 response time
responseTime.description: Autoscale to target a P95 response time of {value}ms or less, per instance

cpu.label: CPU usage
cpu.description: When enabled, scale the service to keep the CPU usage as close as possible to {value}%

memory.label: Memory usage
memory.description: When enabled, scale the service to keep the memory usage as close as possible to {value}%

environmentVariables.title: Environment variables and files
environmentVariables.summary: {variables, plural, =0 {No variables} =1 {{variables} variable} other {{variables} variables}}, {files, plural, =0 {no files} =1 {{files} file} other {{files} files}}
environmentVariables.info: Configure manually or drag and drop file with multiple variables
environmentVariables.valueTooltip: You can reference secrets or environment variables (including Koyeb variables) using <documentationLink>interpolation</documentationLink>

bulkEdition.title: Edit multiple variables
bulkEdition.description: Add, delete or edit environment variables
bulkEdition.line1: Paste your environment variables below, one per line with the format key=value. Empty lines and lines starting with # will be ignored.

fileUpload.notPlainText: You must provide a text file
fileUpload.noEnvVars: No environment variables were identified in the provided file

files.title: Files
files.description: Access content as a file at a specific path

content.label: File content
content.placeholder: Add content, like secrets and variables

ports.old.titleSinglePort: Port {portNumber} exposed {public, select, true {on {path}} other {to the service mesh}}
ports.old.titleMultiplePorts: {count, plural, =0 {No ports exposed} other {{count} ports exposed}}
ports.old.info: Configure the ports and protocols required by your services

path.label: Path
path.tooltip: Your service will be publicly accessible at https://[subdomain].koyeb.app{path}. Requests will be sent to the port you selected and load-balanced between your instances.

public.title: HTTPS
public.description: Expose the HTTP port to the Internet with TLS, anti-DDoS protection, and custom domain support
public.label: Enable
public.disabledTcp: Public HTTPS can only be enabled for HTTP ports

tcpProxy.title: Public TCP access
tcpProxy.description: Expose the TCP port through proxy
tcpProxy.label: Enable
tcpProxy.helperText: Koyeb will create a proxy domain and port (domain:port) to forward traffic to your service's TCP port

http.label: Public HTTPS access
http.description: Expose the HTTP port to the Internet on a specific path
http.disabled: Public HTTPS can only enabled for HTTP ports

tcpProxy.label: Proxy TCP access
tcpProxy.description: Expose the TCP port through proxy
tcpProxy.info: Koyeb will create a proxy domain and port (domain:port) to forward traffic to your service's TCP port

healthChecks.title: Health checks
healthChecks.action: Configure health checks for exposed ports
healthChecks.summaryMultipleHealthChecks: {count, plural, =0 {No health checks configured} other {{count} health checks configured}}

healthCheck.gracePeriodTooltip: The initial period to wait for the instance to become healthy
healthCheck.restartLimitTooltip: The number of consecutive failures before attempting to restart the instance
healthCheck.timeoutTooltip: The maximum time to wait before considering the check as a failure
healthCheck.httpPathTooltip: The path to perform the HTTP health check
healthCheck.httpMethodTooltip: The HTTP method to use to perform the health check

volumes.title: Volumes
volumes.summary: {count, plural, =0 {No volumes} =1 {{count} volume} other {{count} volumes}} configured
volumes.noDowntimeAlert: Attaching volumes to your service will prevent zero-downtime deployments. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumes.noVolumesAttached: Attach and mount a volume to your service to persist data
volumes.detachVolumeNotSupported: Detaching volumes is not supported yet

createDialog.title: Create volume
createDialog.description: Set the name, size and mount path of your volume

volumesUnavailable.unavailableForInstanceTitle: Volumes are not supported on the {instanceName} instance type
volumesUnavailable.unavailableForInstanceDescription: Select another <instancesLink>instance</instancesLink> in order attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumesUnavailable.multipleInstancesTitle: Volumes are not supported for services deployed with more than one instance or with autoscaling enabled
volumesUnavailable.multipleInstancesDescription: Select fixed <scalingLink>scaling</scalingLink> and one instance in order to attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumesUnavailable.unavailableForRegionDescription: Select another <instancesLink>region</instancesLink> in order attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumesUnavailable.multipleRegionsTitle: Volumes are not supported for services deployed across multiple regions
volumesUnavailable.multipleRegionsDescription: Select a single <instancesLink>region</instancesLink> in order to attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>

serviceName.title: Service name
serviceName.editServiceNameWarningWeb: If you change the service name, your service will be assigned a new private address on the service mesh. The public URL will remain identical.

welcomeDialog.title: Your 7-day Pro trial just started!
welcomeDialog.description: Try the Koyeb Pro plan free for 7 days and access advanced platform and collaboration features

features.gpu: Deploy intensive applications across GPUs, CPUs, and Accelerators in minutes
features.scaling: Deploy production-grade containers with zero configuration and automatic scaling
features.cpu: Deploy APIs, distributed systems, or blazing-fast inference endpoints worldwide

welcomeDialog.footer: Once the trial period ends for your Koyeb organization, you can continue with the Pro plan or choose another plan that best fits your needs

banner.content: Your Pro trial ends in {days, plural, =0 {less than 24 hours} =1 {{days} day} other {{days} days}}. To maintain access to Pro features, upgrade now.

summaryPopup.timeLeft: {days, plural, =0 {1 day} =1 {{days} day} other {{days} days}} left in Pro trial

planItem.price: {price} /month {price, select, 0 {+ pay as you go} other {}}

starter.description: For individuals. Pay-per-use, perfect for small apps.
starter.feature1: Generous Free Tier (1x Web Service, 1x Postgres, 5x custom domains)
starter.feature5: Run Inference, APIs, Web Apps, Workers, and Databases

pro.description: Everything in Starter, plus team and support features for production apps

scale.description: Scale your infrastructure, team and support

selectPlan.title: Your Koyeb Pro trial has expired
selectPlan.description: You can easily reactivate your organization by upgrading to a plan
selectPlan.footer: Need more time? <reachOut>Let's chat</reachOut>. You can also continue using our limited Free plan by <downgrade>creating a new organization</downgrade>.

upgrade.title: Your Koyeb Pro trial has expired
upgrade.description: You can easily reactivate your organization by upgrading to a plan

downgrade.title: Downgrade to Free Plan
downgrade.description: To downgrade your account to free plan you need to create a new organization
downgrade.dataLossWarning: All your current services and data will be automatically and permanently removed

footer.message: If you don't want to keep your account, you can <delete>delete it</delete>

main.accountUnderReview: We need more information to approve your account. Please <link>verify your identity</link> to prevent account suspension.
main.sessionTokenWarning: You are currently seeing the organization {organizationName}
main.paymentFailure: We tried to charge your card, but the payment has failed. Please <stripe>update your payment method</stripe> and pay your past due invoices.

upsell.title: Get the full experience
upsell.description: Upgrade to the Starter plan and get $20 of credit on your first invoice to try the full Koyeb experience
upsell.description.new: Upgrade to the Starter pay-as-you-go plan to access the full Koyeb experience

startForFree.title: Start for free, pay as you grow
startForFree.description: Deploy a service for free and enjoy our simple, predictable, and flexible pricing for all your projects

deploy.title: Deploy in seconds
deploy.description: Deploy your apps from Docker images, or connect your git repositories and simply push to deploy

global.title: Run globally in a click
global.description: Run your apps in one or more of our regions according to your needs. Go global with 255+ edge locations

autoscaling.title: Native autoscaling
autoscaling.description: Enjoy autoscaling with high-end performance thanks to high-frequency CPUs and secure Firecracker microVMs

zeroConfig.feature1: Smart and fast autoscaling on GPU and CPU

seamlessDeployment.feature2: Build and deploy anything from web apps to inference
seamlessDeployment.feature3: Native HTTP/2, WebSocket, and gRPC support

anyHardware.feature2: Available globally across 10 regions and 3 continents

authentication.argumentumAdPopulum: Trusted by the most ambitious teams

Upgrade your plan and get started adding your first domain.

home.title: Overview

joinOrganization.sidebar: With Koyeb, run all your models and apps on high-performance CPUs, GPUs, and accelerators from AMD, Intel, and Nvidia
joinOrganization.title: What is your organization's name?
joinOrganization.canBeChanged: You can always change it later if you need to
joinOrganization.tooltip: An organization is a space containing all your Koyeb resources that you can use for your own projects or to collaborate as a team. The organization name must be unique and is used to compose your apps public URL. You can change it at any time.

usage.sidebar: With Koyeb, run all your models and apps on high-performance CPUs, GPUs, and accelerators from AMD, Intel, and Nvidia
usage.title: How do you plan to use Koyeb?

occupation.sidebar: With Koyeb, run all your models and apps on high-performance CPUs, GPUs, and accelerators from AMD, Intel, and Nvidia
occupation.title: What best describes your role?

primaryUseCase.sidebar: Koyeb lets you deploy production-grade containers with zero configuration â€” scale to hundreds of servers and back to zero in seconds
primaryUseCase.title: What's your primary use case?

currentSpending.sidebar: Use Koyeb to improve availability and get sub-100ms latency worldwide with over 50 locations. Pick between one and all locations.
currentSpending.title: What is your monthly spend on could infrastructure?

referralSource.sidebar: With Koyeb, Build APIs, distributed systems, or blazing-fast inference endpoints. Deploy your code, containers, or models with a Git push or CLI call
referralSource.title: How did you hear about Koyeb?

sendInvites.sidebar: Experience collaborative development on high-performance cloud infrastructure with Koyeb
sendInvites.title: Invite your teammates

paymentMethod.sidebar: Start for free. Only pay for what you use, by the second. Scale with your team and stay in control with autoscaling limits.

billingAlert.description: Receive email notifications when your monthly usage gets close to the spending limit

maxScale.title: Scaling may be limited for {instance} instances
maxScale.description: The capacity for this instance type is currently limited, which may prevent service scale-up. To guarantee service scalability, consider switching to a different instance type or region.
